remote_commands.description: The package contains code to execute remote commands (probably limited to a specific set) on the victim's machine.

revshell.description: The package contains code to create a reverse shell, allowing an attacker to execute any commands on the victim's machine.

crypto-related.description: Malicious activity is related to cryptocurrencies or blockchain, e.g. stealing crypto wallets.

obfuscation.description: Code uses obfuscation techniques to hide its true purpose.

dependency-confusion.description: An attempt to exploit dependency confusion

typosquatting.description: The package name is an typosquatting variant of a popular package.

basic_exfiltration.description: The package contains code to exfiltrate basic data from the system, like IP or username. It has a limited risk.

remote_script.description: Downloads and executes a remote malicious script.

exfiltration_crypto.description: The package attempts to steal sensitive cryptocurrency-related data, like wallet keys.

remote_executable.description: Downloads and executes a remote executable.

webhook:telegram.description: A Telegram webhook is used to send collected data.

override_install.description: The package overrides the install command in setup.py to execute malicious code during installation.

infostealer.description: Activity is typical for information stealers, i.e. by exfiltrate various sensitive data from the victim's environment.

malware.description: Package contains or installs known malware.

sandbox-detection.description: The package contains code to detect if it is running in a sandbox environment.

clones_real_package.description: The package is a clone of a real package, but with malicious code added.

action-hidden-in-lib-usage.description: The malicious action is hidden in the code and starts when user interacts with it (e.g. during class initialization or by exfiltrating given credentials).

through_dependency.description: The malicious code is intentionally included in a dependency of the package

script-kid.description: Package uses simple pre-prepared tools to create a low-quality malicious action.

advertisement.description: The package is used to advertise a service or product.

exfiltration_credentials.description: The package attempts to steal credentials, like passwords or API keys.

clones_real_package.description: The package is a clone of a real package, but with malicious code added.

llm-threat.description: Malicious activity is designed against large language models, like e.g. prompt injection.

RAT.description: Malicious activity is typical for Remote Access Trojans (RATs).

covering-tracks.description: The package contains code to cover its tracks, e.g. by deleting malicious code after execution.
